posts.title: A Conceptual Understanding Of Why Attention Is All You Need
posts.excerpt: I break down the key concepts behind the 'Attention is All You Need' paper, explaining how the Transformer architecture revolutionized language modelling and why attention mechanisms are so powerful.

posts.title: Can We Predict Randomness? Modeling Climate Risk with Monte Carlo Simulations
posts.excerpt: I apply Monte Carlo simulations to model climate risk, exploring how we can quantify uncertainty in climate projections and make better decisions in the face of environmental uncertainty.

posts.title: The Emotional Landscape of the Internet: What I learnt from 200M social media posts
posts.excerpt: I analyze 200M posts across X, Reddit, BlueSky, and more to map topics, daily sentiment rhythms, and the polarized shape of online discourse.

posts.title: Why Is Everyone Going to Japan?
posts.excerpt: I analyze travel signals and public data to unpack Japan’s tourism surge—what’s driving it and whether the boom is a short‑term spike or permanent shift.

posts.title: Causal Questions in a Correlational World: Going beyond RCTs
posts.excerpt: Using BRFSS 2023 data and Propensity Score Matching, I estimate the causal impact of regular exercise on mental health and outline a practical, pitfalls‑aware PSM workflow.

posts.title: Causal Questions in a Correlation World, Part II: Measuring How Much and for Whom
posts.excerpt: Moving beyond PSM, I use Inverse Probability Weighting to estimate dose–response and explore treatment‑effect heterogeneity—who benefits most and by how much.

posts.title: Forecasting Fashion: Using Data Science to Decode a Century of Vogue History
posts.excerpt: Applying computer vision and NLP to 90+ years of Vogue covers to quantify trend cycles, brand mentions, and how fashion attributes rise, fall, and return.

posts.title: Timing Is Everything: How Survival Analysis Answers the ‘When’ Question
posts.excerpt: I use IMDb TV series data to show how survival analysis answers time‑to‑event questions with Kaplan–Meier, Log‑Rank tests, Cox PH, and parametric models.

posts.title: Forecasting the Future: Time Series Analysis with SARIMAX and Volatility Modeling
posts.excerpt: I use SARIMAX and GARCH models to forecast time series data, exploring the impact of exogenous variables and capturing volatility patterns.

posts.title: Turning Clickstreams into Strategy: A Markov Chain View of E-commerce Decisions
posts.excerpt: I use Markov chains to analyze clickstream data to predict user behavior on e-commerce platforms.

posts.title: PCA vs Sparse PCA: A Practical Guide to Interpretable Dimensionality Reduction
posts.excerpt: I explore the trade-offs between PCA and Sparse PCA in dimensionality reduction, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses.
